results.title: TVA = Tennessee Valley Authority
results.brief_description: An impersonal survey of the dams built, the irrigation, navigation, and industrial advantages accruing to the people of the Tennessee Valley as a result of this, and the advances made by both agriculture and industry, and social services, since the inception of the Tennessee Valley Authority’s scheme.

results.title: Tuning up for life
results.creator_credit: Reni Mertens, Walter Marti and Teleproduction Zurich
results.brief_description: A class of young children from the Institute of Rhythmics, Zurich, at work under the direction of Mimi Scheiblauer, who built the Institute on the principles of Calcroze’s eurhythmics. Children’s natural urge to move around and make a noise is guided by music and used to develop qualities of control and attention. Miss Scheiblauer discusses some of the principles involved.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Reni Mertens, Walter Marti and Teleproduction Zurich

results.title: Tukiki and his search for a Merry Christmas
results.creator_credit: Vic Atkinson, Beryl Friesen, W.H. Stephens and Pooled Film Services
results.brief_description: An animated children’s film in which Tukiki, an Eskimo boy, sees Christmas celebrated all over the world. Uses beautiful xerox and pastel backgrounds throughout. Created and written by Christine Atkinson with the voice of Sterling Holloway.

results.title: Tucker
results.brief_description: Highlights the importance of good food habits. The importance of early experiences is emphasized, together with the valuable role of the school canteen and the teachers who promote good eating habits using the basic five food groups.

results.title: Tsipa and Volf
results.brief_description: A documentary about the filmmaker’s grandparents who were both survivors of the Nazi Holocaust against the European Jews. Tsipa and Wolf met, married and started a new family together built on the sadness of what they left behind in Europe. With the advent of Alzheimer’s, this union is finally falling apart. This warm, sad, funny and ultimately humane documentary is also a loving testimonial to the importance of family life.
